cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles west of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking south-to-southeast, away from the west-central Florida coast and toward the southeastern Gulf / northwestern Caribbean
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall expected (system forecast to drift south and degenerate over open Gulf)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central eastern Gulf of Mexico well offshore; no direct coastal impacts expected for the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No location within table for west-central Florida (probability <3 %)
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected at the port (probability <1 %)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected because the system remains weak and offshore, moving away from the Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches possible through Saturday with isolated pockets up to 5 inches across portions of the central/southern peninsula; localized urban or poor-drainage flooding could occur
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls or thunderstorms unrelated to the depression may intermittently halt cargo handling
